links_reviews_text: This dress was a little long for my 5 ft 2 in frame but it worked well with 3 in heels. It is a true, deep, candy apple red. The material is satiny and flowy and was very fun when dancing. The fit of the dress allowed me to go without wearing any shaping garments under the dress and there were no concerns about visible panty or bra lines in the dress. I did have to adjust my bra to hide the straps due to the interesting neckline. Overall, this dress is beautiful, simple, and I was sad to take the dress off at the end of the evening.

True to size. I'm usually a size 10, but ordered up just to be safe. Super stretchy and comfortable material so I could have easily gone down a size. So many compliments. I ended up wearing it to two separate Christmas parties :)

It was my second option dress and i liked quite a bit. It was a little longer that I would've liked and has a raw hem at the bottom, which is not very noticeable. It doesn't have a zipper but the fabric stretches quite a bit to put it on, but you have to be careful with the makeup and deodorant as to not stain it. The size 2 fitted ok, but felt more comfortable with the size 4.

This dress is amazing! It's pretty and simple- so Audrey Hepburn. The dress is a thick stretchy material that fits perfectly and smooths bumps. I would buy this to have in my closet- it's a great price and such a classic cut, it could absolutely be a staple wardrobe piece.

I adored this. My favorite rental thus far. The fabric was a thick stretchy material - didn't show bra lines or anything! Was sooo pretty. Tons of compliments. I felt like it was Audrey Hepburn's style. So classic and timeless!

I loved this dress! It was so comfortable and flattering. I rented this for a formal wedding and it was dressy enough, yet not at all restrictive when I wanted to dance. The fabric is super thick and does not wrinkle. I couldn't quite get the "off the shoulder" look with the size I ordered. It was more like a 45-degree angle and the armpits were extremely tight. If I would've gone up one size I think the fit would've been better. This is such a perfect, versatile dress!

I rented this dress for a black tie optional wedding. I didn't love how it looked on me, but that wasn't the dress's fault! I wore the same size I do in all clothes. The fabric is on the thicker side and very stretchy. I'm not sure what kind of fabric this dress is, but it does. not. wrinkle. Perfect for traveling to a wedding! The arm straps were snug and really never moved out of place, but do limit arm movement somewhat. They do not go straight across the bicep area, but the fabric lays flat when they are kinda half off the shoulder. My only issue with this dress is it pulls on/off over your head. While it's stretchy, it's still snug. That was definitely a pain. With a zipper, it would've been 5 stars!

links_reviews_title: Great classic black dress. Get it!
links_reviews_text: Loved the material and the fit. It was true to size. I would absolutely rent this again. Great company, so glad I found you. I’ll never buy a formal dress again.

I wore this to a wedding. It was tricky getting the sleeves to stay in place but was very comfortable. And the material was very forgiving. The length was a little longer than tea length but it still looked great. Only downside for me was the fact that it did not have pockets. Pockets and it would be 5 stars for me.

links_reviews_title: This classy black dress was perfect for a winter January wedding! Paired with bold heels!
links_reviews_text: This dress fit well in the shoulders and was mid calf in length.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a formal work function
links_reviews_text: Rented this dress for an award ceremony. It was perfect, nice fabric somewhat stretchy. The arms were a little hard to raise your arms and moved some, but nothing too terrible. Would rent this again!

I usually wear a size 6 in jeans but I easily wore the 4 in this dress. This dress wore really well. It was comfortable to dance in for hours. The only reason I didn't give it all of the stars was because of it not having a liner or hem really. It made it feel a little cheap. Also it is a very simple dress. Not a lot of flair to it. Overall very comfortable & flattering.
It fit well and was so comfortable the entire night. I'd rent it again!
This dress fit beautifully but was a little longer for my height than i would have liked. It stayed on my shoulders easily. Very classy!

links_reviews_title: Prefect off the shoulder look while classy!
links_reviews_text: No bra wonder! Nice thickness to not show anything! Wish I could have bought this to wear to every event!
I felt elegant and graceful! I was able to dance the night away at a wedding so comfortably.

Rented for a small outdoor wedding, wore it for 12 hours straight and it was still pretty comfortable! Stretchy fabric, yet elevated elegance with the off-the-shoulder look. I'm tall (5'11) and this went past my knees.

links_reviews_title: Elegant dress for an elegant event.....
links_reviews_text: I felt very elegant in this dress. I would definitely rent this dress again. I did keep pushing the sleeves down, but wasn't a huge deal for me. I rented the 4 with a 2 as the back-up size. Although I could have worn either, the 4 felt a bit more comfortable so I went with that. I would like to own this dress.

links_reviews_title: Wish I would've gotten a different dress
links_reviews_text: The size 12 dress fit fine, however, the shoulders were annoying because if they weren't down far enough the chest wouldn't lay flat so I was adjusting them all night. Also, after going through so many gorgeous gowns on RTR, I was underwhelmed by the presence of this dress. No compliments, no nothing. While it's nice, I wouldn't recommend this dress if you're looking for wow factor.

Perfect dress for a bridesmaid or any other formal event. There is no zipper so you just slip it over your head and there is enough stretch in the fabric for it to be comfortable to do so I could have gone with the 8R or 10R but I went with the 10R as it was looser in the arms and not as tight thru the rib cage which made it easier for dancing I would have kept it if I could have, it was so comfortable and I got so many compliments

This dress was a formal work event. The fabric is really stretchy and Greta if you need to love around. The off the shoulder stayed in place well. I received tons of compliments. The only thing that would make this dress better is if it had pockets. Would definitely rent this one again. Simple and elegant.
Was perfect for a wedding - fit like a glove and so flattering! I'm 5'4, 125 pounds and size 2 worked great!
This dress was perfect for the setting. It was classy and made you feel stunning. Perfect fit

links_reviews_title: This was the BEST dress I have ever rented.
links_reviews_text: Dress fit like a glove - extremely figure flattering, and hid my "Mommy tummy". I was worried the arms would stretch out and sag by the end of the night, but that's impossible with this type of fabric. Arms stayed in place and were very comfortable - zero issues with dancing. I felt gorgeous, and would rent this dress again in a heart beat. Don't overlook this gem!!
Fit is great for people who are smaller on top and larger on the bottom

links_reviews_title: Classy dress, but would probably not rent again.
links_reviews_text: This dress was longer than I would have preferred (also I am a bit on the shorter side), and the end wasn't seamed, so the fabric was uneven at the end and did not look fully put together.
Nice stretch to the fabric and fitted in all the right places. I liked the length too. I'm 5'4" and it hit a little past my shins. Perfect for a wedding!

links_reviews_title: Perfect dress, great quality & RTR experience!
links_reviews_text: I am a pear shape and this dress is a perfect fit for a pear shape. It has a natural waist and then flows from there. The material is thick and does not show sweat, which is great for summer weddings in the South. I got a ton of compliments on it! The top fits right with stretch, but if you are insecure about your arms or the fabric possibility cutting you off at the arms, then this may not be your dress. I normally wear a 6 for my hips/butt, but I was able to wear the 4 due to fit. Thank heavens for a back up size! I would rent this one agin, recommend it for others, and I absolutely will be doing RTR again! This was my first time and it was worth every penny and very friendly easy!
Fit was perfect and flattering. Material was heavy enough to be smooth but light enough to be comfortable. Would definitely rent again.

links_reviews_title: Didn't want to return the dress!
links_reviews_text: This was my first rent the runaway and the only thing that I didn't like was having to return the dress. I LOVED IT! I wore it to a gala my organization was hosting/I was working and it was so comfortable and fit so well! Everyone commented on how much they loved it, and I just felt great! How do I purchase it?!?
The neckline is sophisticated. The fabric was a little stretchy without looking cheap.

links_reviews_title: Wore this for a wedding. Very comfortable!
links_reviews_text: I was expecting a dress that had to be zipped up but you just slide it on. Has a stretchy spandex feel to it which I personally loved. The off the shoulder look was classy and I didn’t feel like my arms were restricted in the least. Got many compliments. I’m 5’7” 157lbs and the size 6 fit perfect:)
Sleeves do move some when dancing.

This picture makes the dress look longer than it actually is, more of a below-the-knee than tea length. Lots of compliments! Just had to keep pulling the sleeves down. They were fitted and kept riding up. Overall, loved it!!

links_reviews_title: We had a delicious dinner and laughed our butts off at the Addams Family musical.
links_reviews_text: This dress fit so well. I felt fantastic and beautiful all night. The material is incredibly flattering and thick enough I was able to go braless without pasties. If you think you'll be moving arms dancing or anything, the straps might irritate you but it was great for dinner and the theater! I do wish the straps had been more comfortable being in the same position as the model photo but being able to move freely is pretty awesome. The length was perfect. It was long enough to be classy without being matronly.
I love this dress, it's very flattering on my pear shape. The only con is that the fabric is kind of slick, so it shows what's underneath... definitely go with some spanx ladies.
Felt fantastic during an early spring wedding - comfortable and elegant, perfect with drop earrings and a statemdng bracelet.

links_reviews_title: I heard "stunning" all night! The perfect combination of classy, formal and fitted up top.
links_reviews_text: The material is high quality. I felt glamorous in it. It fits snug from the waist up and flows in all the right ways from the waist down. I liked the mid calf length on my 5'4" body.

links_reviews_title: I got a ton of compliments wearing this dress. It was perfect for the formal I was attending
links_reviews_text: It fit like a glove. The only con I would say with the dress is that I could not lift my arms past a certain point.

This dress was a great classic look and very comfortable. It was a nice thick material with great stretch to it, I opted to not wear a bra with it because of how the material hugged to my skin. The only awkward part of the dress were the arms, it limited movement.

links_reviews_title: Sommany compliments all night. The dress was so comfortable
links_reviews_text: Fit perfectly. I could have worm the 132 too but the length and with the 10 I had enough support to not wear a bra. (36D) This was my firsf RTR purchase and i could be happier.

links_reviews_title: It was my High School Formal
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress and got so many compliments! Super flattering, comfortable, and easy to wear. I highly recommend this dress! I would wear another one like it in a heartbeat!

links_reviews_title: Runs big, low cut, color is slightly darker than pictured
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress, wore it to my college graduation party. Hervé léger has the best dress material (like built in spanx). This dress ran big, I wore a M definitely could have used a size S (the dress would have hugged me better and given me more shape). The top was very low cut so I could not wear a bra with the dress because the bra would show. Also, the dress was longer then other Hervé Léger dresses I have worn in the past. Also, the color of the dress was slightly darker than I expected.

The dress fit like a glove and accentuated my hips and cleavage perfectly. The material was great because it was soft yet thick which kept everything "sucked in"- similar to spanks. I absolutely loved this color for the summer and it complimented my skin tone. For sizing- This dress was on-point with measurements and being TTS.

This dress was so comfortable to wear. It's made of a heavy stretchable fabric that hides all of your flaws. I don't have any undergarments on with it here but could wear a bra if I wanted too. It's lower cut but snug in the chest so my 34DD's didn't feel like they were falling out. It's flared just a bit in the skirt so it moves well with you when you walk. Typically I would have gotten a small but it wasn't available so I opted for the medium and it was great. The color is more of an orange coral but very flattering.

The fabric is thick and would hold you in and make you look skinny if you size down. I got my regular size and it worked, but it was not snug enough to do that (like I would have liked it to do) Girls with big hips or booty could size down easily bc of the A line skirt

links_reviews_title: Best dress for V day celebration
links_reviews_text: Really cute, great for full figured ladies
So flattering. I love the material and fit. I wish I could keep this.

The dress I originally ordered became unavailable so this was one that I chose as a replacement. It was very flattering, nice and thick, and comfortable. It's quite low cut so it was hard to find a bra that didn't show. I also found myself pulling it up all night but that was more out of fear it was too low than necessity.

links_reviews_title: the color of the dress was perfect
links_reviews_text: fit it great. my boobs are big so I used a little tape to keep from having a nip slip because the dress material is heavy

I love how it helped suck everything in and still comfortable. I wore this while vacationing in Miami for my birthday. I wish it was a little shorter, because in Miami it felt too long, lol! But at least I was keeping it classy. I feel like it made my bust appear smaller, and I'm pretty large, but it was nice to feel comfortable not wearing a bra.

The color and cut of the dress are great. I thought it was very flattering. I would've preferred it an inch or two shorter, but it was still short enough to be cute. Only complaint was that my boobs barely fit in the dress, not sure how this would work for larger chested ladies

In love with this dress. God bless Herve and the "I'm wearing 3 pairs of Spanx" feel his dresses give. This dress really lifts & accentuates the 'girls' up top. It was perfect for a Monaco F1 party, but I probably wouldn't choose it for a conservative event if you have large breasts. I thought I'd be a Medium (typically I'm a 6-8), but chose Small... I ordered both, but the Small was much more flattering on me. Whatever size you think you'd be, pick the smaller size for your back-up to compare. I hate when the entire dress is a tight bandage from top to bottom (it makes my butt look a mile long), but this has the perfect amount of 'fit and flare' to avoid that butt-hugging look... it was very flattering!

I wore this dress to my 52nd birthday party. It was sooooo comfortable. The fit was perfect. It was lovely, feminine and sexy! I would totally rent again! The only thing is.... the 10 was too big up top and the 8 fit perfectly everywhere else but it sure was low cut. Still, it was a lovely dress! You just can't go wrong with Herve Leger!

links_reviews_title: A vibrant (but heavy and low-cut) splash of color
links_reviews_text: Enjoyed wearing this dress to my college reunion. Ultimately I don't think it was the best for my body type; even though the material was heavy, it clung to my body very tightly and showed off every nook and cranny in my midsection, which is my problem spot. It was very low cut, and it wasn't that supportive for me--my cleavage didn't look particularly great . But the color is fantastic and it got a lot of compliments from old friends!

links_reviews_title: It was my actual birthday dinner with friends.
links_reviews_text: I suggest getting a size that is a little smaller. I tried on a small at the store and it fit well but was a little snug but bearable. In the end, I ordered a medium and it did not work out well. It looked nice but the straps were falling down from time to time and the dress stretched out where I was constantly picking up and making sure everything was covered. Beautiful fit but definitely should have ordered a small. This designers dresses stretch females.
Beautiful color and flattering dress. Typical Herve... tight and well constructed to make everything smooth. Loved it

links_reviews_title: Per usual HL is a winner.
links_reviews_text: Wore this to a "Glam Country" themed birthday. Fits pretty standard HL, I tend to go either XS or S depending on the chest. This I could have done either but worst the small since it was the one available. The color looks far richer and in real life. One of my favorite rentals!
Fit like a glove, no bra needed as material is thick and heavy but still perfect for a sunny day!

links_reviews_title: Amazing fit; hugs in all the right places; compliments all night!
links_reviews_text: Rented it for a gala in Vegas and it did not disappoint!

Loved this Herve - the color was stunning but I'd recommend it for someone either with olive skin or a nice spray tan (I had the latter). It's a beautiful fit in the chest and bodice but I'd recommend it for women 5'3 and up, as I can imagine the skirt being a bit too full for someone shorter. It's also not a mini dress -- hit me about an inch or two above the knee. So fun to dance it and ELEGANT despite being bodycon. Highly recommend for women 5'5 and up :)

links_reviews_title: Best dress i've ever rented, considered buying it
links_reviews_text: Wore this to a sorority formal. Fit was great, thick material sucks you in! I totally get why people spend so much money on Herve Leger dresses now. Color came out orange in photos, but is slightly peachier in person. I had to make sure that my bra didn't peak out all night, but probably wouldn't be a problem for anyone with C or smaller chest. I taped the dress shoulder straps to my bra, which kept them from sliding around. Otherwise grateful that I could wear a normal bra!

There was so much to love about this dress- the material was great, the color was rich, great for dancing all night. My difficulty with the dress is my bra kept showing with every move. If I was smaller chested going without a bra would be a great option, however that's not the case.

The chest was a little tricky either you can push them down and they look smooshed or there is a little too much cleavage. But over all a great flirty dress. Great for an evening in Mexico. Perfect fabric because it's a little chilly at night.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous color, Herve Léger never disappoints!
links_reviews_text: I wore this for a 25th reunion event. I wore the S, though I could have worn the XS, I wanted more coverage in the chest (the girls were on display plenty in the S!) and to feel more comfortable. Classic Herve fit... like wearing built-in Spanx. I am curvy with a small waist, so having a dress that fits in the chest, waist and hips, accentuating my curves, is priceless. Color was fantastic in a sea of black dresses. The hubs gave it a big "WOW!" and I got compliments all night. Tip: Dont hang Herve's by the straps. Fold it and put it on the hanger like pants. Prevents stretching. I would own a closet full of Herve if I could, so I'm grateful for RTR. Already reserved the blue cage dress for my anniversary!

I got a million compliments on this dress! The color is an orange-y coral mix. The signature HL bandage tightens and smooths your entire body making you look super skinny. And the flare skirt makes it more appropriate for cocktail hour. I absolutely loved this look!

links_reviews_title: This dress was made by the hands of love
links_reviews_text: A beautiful tangerine dress. Perfect dress to transition from spring to summer to fall. As with everything Herve, it is heavy construction and weighty and going directly into my regular Unlimited rotation. A nice combo of sexy and cute and a super flattering A-line. I recommend sizing down. Love this!

links_reviews_title: Flirty and fun, with delicious color!
links_reviews_text: Didn't end up wearing due to the stain it was shipped with, but it was brand new with tags. The style would be flattering for any body type, especially since it nips the waist in for a super curvy hourglass look. Wanted to keep it to wear for a night out, but had to return due to the stain. I can't say enough about the saturated tangerine color. So fun for summer!

links_reviews_title: Beautiful Color! Compliments All Night Long!
links_reviews_text: I wore this out for a dinner date with friends and was very excited when it arrived! The color is a coral color and not a red FYI. The dress was tight but fit nicely once I added some Spanx. My only issue was that it was low in the front and my strapless bra showed a bunch throughout the night and I was having to pull the dress up often. I would recommend though and look forward to wearing another dress by Herve again soon.

links_reviews_title: Loved this color, material and fit!
links_reviews_text: Great fit and very flattering; especially for an hourglass body type. Received several compliments!

links_reviews_title: Flirty and fun for a girls night out or date night! The bandage fabric really sucks you in!
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size. If you have a large chest, it is quite revealing due to the neckline. Perfect for Miami though!

This dress was very cute and perfect mini length for my 5'3" frame. I have an athletic build, but didn't love the way this dress looked in my midsection. I tried spanx under to see if it would smooth out and not highlight my belly button area so much, but you could see the spanx lines so I opted not to wear. The top area is pretty low cut so also didn't wear a bra.
cute but my breast were spilling over. I felt like I was showing a little too much.
It was short I'm 5'3 and it was short on me
I love the fit of the waist line however, the straps and neck line felt stretched out. Maybe it was hung by the straps. It is a pretty heavy material.

links_reviews_title: I'm sending it back. Just not comfortable in it.
links_reviews_text: It's a cute dress but my boobs are POPPING out of the top. I thought I might be uncomfortable with the length but ultimately it is too much cleavage for me.

It fit like a glove and was very sexy. My 11 year old daughter thought it was way too tight and "boob-y" for the party we were going to so at her request I wore something else. I will definitely rent it again. It's super hot!

links_reviews_title: I loved the color but the dress seemed a little worn.
links_reviews_text: The dress was pretty worn
This dress is beautiful very snug fitting! But I chose to go with my 1st choice!
I actually find Herve runs 'large', even though they are 'skin tight'.. Order normal size

links_reviews_title: If I didn't need a bra...
links_reviews_text: Not made to wear with a bra. Maybe if you were a size b or smaller?
Was slightly loose, but this romper is better too loose than too tight. Shorts are a little longer than I would've liked, but loved the color and overall a good rental. Would wear it again!

Got for a concert at a casino. It was so comfortable yet sexy. Didn't have to wear a bra, adequate coverage! Material is little thick but not heavy. Guy sitting next to me complemented me on it! The shorts were also long enough so felt comfortable bending over.

I'm typically between a 2 and 4 but went with the 2 since 4 wasn't available and other than wishing the torso had been slightly longer, it still fit just fine. Very thick material and beautiful color. Would definitely recommend!
I wore this to a NYC day party. It was very comfortable to dance and move around in. I got so many compliments on the design and I felt like the color popped against my skin tone!
This romper fit very well and was particularly comfortable. The fabric was great, with a little stretch and didn't wrinkle at all. I got lots of compliments. Good for an athletic body type.
Fit was perfect all around including length.

links_reviews_title: Fun, but heavy material for heat
links_reviews_text: This piece was fun for a night out... and though clearly a summer romper, the material was a heavier cotton crepe and it was fully-lined - quality, but hot for warm weather. It was also very long in the torso, and I have a long torso for an average height gal. Shorts were a nice length - not too short or too long. Color is a great turquoise. You can wear a strapless or racerback bra, if you choose.
Loved this. Perfect for beach vacation in Mexico. Fit great and loved it. Only con is that you have to fully unzip to go bathroom and its hard to zip back up by yourself.
Super cute romper that takes you from day to night. Only complaint it's a little hard to zip up and down on your own
Looked super cute and was really comfortable. Nice sturdy fabric, too. A little loose fitting in the size I got.

links_reviews_title: Several women asked me where I got it, and I received lots of compliments!
links_reviews_text: It is true to size and there was no need to wear a bra!!! I am a size 34B and I've had four kids, so I thought that it was also supportive and thick material so that you don't show headlights, nor pop out. In other words I felt like a million bucks in this thing!

I wore this outfit to a bridal brunch and I got so many compliments on it! The color was perfect, and the material was so comfortable. I'm actually looking into purchasing this outfit I loved it so much!

links_reviews_title: Love the color! Fun style-just not for me!
links_reviews_text: Super soft romper, great color & cutouts. Not flattering on me. Baggy in torso.

I loved this romper so much- I wore it out while in Vegas for a bachelorette weekend and felt so confident and perfect the whole night. I'm very petite (5 ' 1") but have a butt and thicker thighs as well as a 34C bust so tiny clothing items that contain shorts or have to zip in the back of my torso will often be too short and not zip up all the way on me, so I never know if a 0 will end up being way too small, way too big, or perfect, and I'm even more weary that a size 2 will be huge on me. After reading every single review I finally decided that a 0 would be perfect but a 2 would still likely be okay- only a size 2 was available for when I needed it and I'm so happy for that because it fit absolutely perfectly in every way possible. The bright blue color is unique and fun and the cut outs and fit make it sexy, so it's a perfect combo of fun and sexy that I wish I could own :) This pic was from the very end of the night after many hours of dancing and spilling drinks so it doesn't look like it fits as well as it truly did. I didn't wear a bra but had on silicone nipple stickies and felt totally covered and secure!

This outfit was a little outside my comfort zone--I don't wear rompers often, and I've never worn anything with a cutout--but I absolutely loved it! As others have noted, the midsection did slouch a bit in the front and back (but not too much) and you couldn't tell in pictures. The fabric is stretchy so it moves with you--it's not restrictive-- and the color is so gorgeous! I wish I could have kept this one!

The 10 wasn't availabile so I got a 12. 10 would have been a better fit. The 12 was slightly loose and the shorts were too long. I used safety pins and made them shorter to wear for the nyc pride parade

links_reviews_title: Fabulous Romper for my Birthday at Lakefront Brewery!
links_reviews_text: This romper was so fun! I loved the color. Felt so classy! I dressed it up with a statement necklace. The 12 was the only size left, and was a bit big, but it worked. I wore a strapless bra and had no issues with it showing. I agree with other reviews - the cut outs are flattering even if you have some love in your love handles. Definitely would recommend.

This romper was perfect for my birthday brunch in DC. It fit me perfectly and I was never worried about it riding up in the back. It was sexy without making me feel over exposed. I received countless complements and loved the way I felt (and looked) in this outfit

This little outfit was definitely a step out of my comfort zone, but I loved it! I felt very confident after I had it on. Beautiful color and nice fit. I didn't end up wearing a bra with it because I really didn't need to!

I wore this for a night out on my honeymoon in vegas. It was comfortable and simple. It needs to be heavily accessorized if you want to look dressed up. I like that my butt didnt hang out of the shorts (something I was worried about), and the color is great.

Loved everything about this romper. The color is unique (I usually gravitate towards dark colors or pink) and the fit is flattering. It is comfortable as well. The only downside is that the zipper is very small so I couldn't unzip it myself and had to ask random people in the bathroom to do that for me. I would definitely recommend for a fun night out!

I'm short waisted so the top portion was a little too long for me. I was able to kind of tuck it in and make it work. Fabric is really comfortable and pockets are great, and best of all, the shorts were long enough so my thighs didn't rub. Thank god!

Wore this for a friend's Bachelorette party where a "teal/blue" outfit was required. This outfit really has the WOW factor. Loved this, the fit was awesome, and I received a ton of compliments!!! Would DEF rent again

links_reviews_title: Great Color, Great Cut outs, Great Fit!
links_reviews_text: So cute! I ran around all night celebrating my birthday, and it was so comfortable. And flattering! The color is awesome, and the cut outs give it the perfect amount of sexiness! Would definitely recommend!

The beautiful romper fit perfectly. I was worried about the torso area but there was no gap or weird fit issues- it was lovely. The top fit snug enough that I didn't have to worry about a bra, which helped avoid any strap issues. The color is stunning. I felt amazing in this outfit!

links_reviews_title: Being able to get my rental the next day at short notice.
links_reviews_text: I ordered sizes 8 and 10. Right now I am in between sizes. I tried on both sizes. The 8 was tight in the back area but I have a wide back but it fit in all of the other areas and the 10 was big in the crotch area and I had a slight gap in the back above the tailbone which is due to my short torso. I didn't want to feel uncomfortable so I wore the 10 so I would be comfortable. I wore this to a bachelorette celebration. This was my first time trying to wear a romper. I received many compliments on the romper. Loved the cut outs. I paired it with a 3.5 inch red patent leather platform and a statement necklace. It doesn't fit as well on us short torso women.
I have a long torso and this fit great. Very fun piece.

links_reviews_title: Turquoise blue romper mirrored the Miami sea & matched my swimsuit with almost the exact cut out!
links_reviews_text: This romper was a total hit at my working vacation at a modeling convention, where we got breaks and often then had to report back for just brief judging of events. It's well made & tailored with a slightly classier longer shorts with pockets that balance the racer cut outs a bit. Or I threw on a crisp white blouse. It so happened my swimsuit was the same color and cut ! Magical easy in & out cover up from pool to hotel & Back with nice sandals. It's reallY cute. If it were not so worn. I am obviously not the first to love it, I would definitely buy it. I might call about a fresher one. It's especially. Nice on someone blonde and a bit tan and blue eyed like me too ; ) I got a lot of compliments for such a little ditty .

links_reviews_title: Nun told me I looked great!
links_reviews_text: Wore to a bridal shower. Complements all day even my aunt who is a catholic nun!!! The color is amazing. I am a little short in the torso so it was a bit baggy there. It was the 1st thing my father said to me, overall it fit well everywhere else
Loved every minute in this! Super comfy danced the day away. Chose the bigger size so it lessens the camel toe! Highly recommend this romper!

links_reviews_title: His Words..... you are absolutely beautiful tonight
links_reviews_text: If your are a pear shaped lady prepare for the need for low rise undergarments. Short length was adequate..no "cheekage" like with most rompers. It wasn't flimsy material that is easily wrinkled or grading you in unsightly places.

Loved this romper and got lots of compliments. The material has more of a cotton feel and is a bit stretchy. I usually wear a 6 and ended up wearing the 4. It was snug enough around the bust area to go braless, which was a huge plus for me!

Just the right amount of stretch and I wound up not having to wear a bra which was great sat the neck line would have made it tricky. The color was great too! Loved the pockets. Wish I owned this piece!!

Wore this to a weekend bachelorette which required one night of neon clothes. It wasn't the most neon thing in the group, but it did the trick. Was a cute romper, loved the cutouts, but a little bunchy in the fupa area. Still would wear it again.
I love the length and the material is super luxe but not too thick. No bra needed!

links_reviews_title: Fun romper Vibrant color! Comfortable and sexy. A++
links_reviews_text: Loved this romper. It can be casual or dressed up for a fun date. I'm 5'3 so the torso was a little loose but I still rocked it! It's a definite head turner, and color is super fun. Not much stretch but runs true to size. Shorts are a little long, but still very cute!
Loved the color of this one. The romper was a little worn (you could Tell it got lots of love in the past), but the cut was flattering, so I didn't mind. Super comfortable + pockets.
PROS: perfect fit, great quality material, loved the turquoise color, super comfy! I would rent this again in fact I would buy it! Stunning on and sexy! NO CONS! Love love love this romper!

As someone with a very long torso, finding a romper that fits is definitely a struggle. This one, however, fit perfectly! I wore this for a birthday party at a club in NYC and it was perfect.The fit of it and the material made it so comfortable to wear and the bright color was gorgeous. I would definitely rent this again.

I loved the color of this outfit. It was well made and ran true to size. However, if you have somewhat of a short torso like I do, it may not be the best choice for you. The zippered part really bunched up in the lower back area instead of laying flat. The larger size 12 did the exact same thing plus was too big so I wore the size 10. I used fashion tape as a work-around to keep the back panel as flat and flush to my skin as possible. I got tons of compliments anyway! All things considered, it was a decent rental. This romper will require assistance to zip it up and down. I had to limit my alcohol consumption so I wouldn't need to visit the ladies' room often because it was such a hassle.

links_reviews_title: The fit and style of this dress was perfect!
links_reviews_text: The dress fit a little tighter in the hips but overall made me feel beautiful! Just had to be careful the liner didn't slip up.

I absolutely loved this dress and wore it for my bridal shower, it was very flattering without being tight or uncomfortable and I got so so many compliments. It was a little short but that was only noticeable when sitting so I wouldn't say that was a big deal at all. Would absolutely recommend.
Cute dress, kind of short with reasonable heel height.

links_reviews_title: Pretty but size up to avoid body con effect
links_reviews_text: I loved this dress but my curves were on major display and therefore was not appropriate for the occasion I originally rented this for (graduate school reception). Would rent again in L or after dropping the extra 15 lbs I'm carrying right now.

I rented this dress to wear for a night out after my wedding. The dress fit true to size and a great length (I'm 5'3''). The material was thicker than expected with a lot of stretch. It looks even better in person!

This was actually ordered as my second option dress because the dress I had rented initially did not fit. I am so glad I got the stress, I got lots of compliments. It looks beautiful on. It's very flattering.

links_reviews_title: I wore this dress for my bridal shower and loved it!
links_reviews_text: I absolutely loved this dress and got compliments all day in it! My only complaint is it kind of bunched in the mid section and made a weird roll situation!

I am currently in-between sizes and range from a 27 in madewell jeans to 28 in Joes. I'm 5'2 and 125lbs and typically carry weight in my stomach, which tends to be my issue when guessing sizes. My bust is 34, waist 29, and hips 30 something. This brand seems to be outside of vanity sizing and more true to actual sizes. If you're close to my measurements definitely get a six and based on your typical size go with your extra at the size under or over. I tried an 8 (medium) and it was too big.
Rented for a bridal shower. Great fit, good length for me (not too short or long), and very comfortable. Felt like good, quality fabric.

links_reviews_title: Perfect dress for spring bridal shower
links_reviews_text: I rented this dress for my bridal shower in April and it was PERFECT !! I had originally rented the large and it fit like a glove but it was a little to fitted through the hips and thighs which made the dress a bit short and lead to some slight bagging in the top portion around the waist. The XL was more comfortable for me and a little more event appropriate, however the top fit better for me in the large (arms,neckline). Overall I would say that it fits true to size but if you have a butt or thicker/athletic hips and thighs you might want to size up for additional length/comfort.

I rented this for my bridal shower and received so many compliments. The only reason I didn't give this dress 5 stars is because, with my long legs, it was a bit shorter than I wanted it to be. The dress is fairly form fitting, in my opinion, but still compliments curves. When I sat down I felt it rode up a little high, and my sisters had to watch the lining (it kept riding up!). But otherwise I loved this dress and was very happy with it for my bridal shower.

I wore this to my bridal shower and it was PERFECT! I got so many compliments throughout the day. The dress was very comfortable and fit great. It was a little bit on the short side but I only had to be mindful of it when I was sitting down (especially while I was sitting in front of everyone while I opened presents). I HIGHLY recommend this for a shower OR rehearsal dinner!

I rented this for my bridal shower and it was absolutely perfect. It bunches a little but in the stomach area, but it didn't bother me and i think it looked fine. I went with the large so that I would have room to move in it and the bunching looked less obvious in the large (it looked like it was the dress - which it was - instead of it just didn't fit..) got sooooo many compliments in it and felt like a rockstar.
This dress was perfect for my bridal shower! It fit perfectly and I loved the detail of the bell sleeve. It was the perfect flirty length and I got so many compliments!

I got many compliments on this dress for my bridal shower! I ordered the small and medium but ended up wearing the medium. I am 5 ft 3 130 lbs and carry most of my weight in my midsection so the small was a little too snug. The chest on the medium was a bit loose on me as a 32B. The fabric was high quality and overall I liked the dress.

links_reviews_title: loved it, got so many compliments
links_reviews_text: its stretchy which is great! the knitted details were a classic touch. loved the bell sleeves!
I am 5 foot and am a 34 DD, and the medium fit perfect! The material was so flattering, and I was comfortable all night! It was perfect for my wedding rehearsal.
Received so many compliments on this dress; it couldn't have fit more perfect! Loved it!
I wore this for my bridal shower and received so many compliments! The lining would bunch sometimes so I would have to readjust. Overall I would highly recommend to rent this dress!

I loved this dress! I rented it for my wedding rehearsal and rehearsal dinner and got so many compliments on it! It was a little tight around my mid-section, so you may want to size up for your backup just in case. I loved the sleeves and thought it was absolutely perfect.

Wore for my dressier part of our photos. This is the 'worst' it looked, so sharing it. It is cute! But does want crinkle when walking as shown. The rest of the photos the dress is lying flat and very figure flattering

links_reviews_title: Felt comfortable all night & got so many compliments
links_reviews_text: Wore this dress for my engagement party. Little on the shorter side, but wasn't uncomfortable.
Loved this dress and was perfect for my bridal shower! If you have a large chest, or are curvy, I recommend sizing up, otherwise, no complaints! Received many compliments. Highly recommend!

Overall, amazing dress. SO MANY COMPLIMENTS. Super flattering, good length for shorter person. The nude liner is very thick, so do not recommend for a warm day or any event if you could be sweaty at all. But it worked well for my indoor/outdoor bridal shower on a cool fall day. Easy to wear for several hours and to sit down in. May be short for average height or tall person, as I am on the shorter side and the length fit just right. I am heavier chested and didn't need to wear a bra, since the dress is a tight fit in the chest area and there is a thick liner. Couldn't have loved this dress more.

links_reviews_title: I LOVED THIS DRESS!!! So many compliments
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress to my bridal shower. It is fun, comfy, and flattering. The fabric is a little heavy, and definitely would not have been comfortable to wear if it had been warmer outside. I loved the sleeves and the lace, and I got so many compliments. It was only available in a size XL, even though the L probably would have fit me a little better, however, it worked, and I love the way it looked. I would recommend this dress to anyone who is a little bustier but with a straight or slightly hour glass body. It creates shape, which I don't usually have. All in all, a wicked cute dress!

I rented this even after reading the reviews and seeing photos of the fit. The main issue I have with this dress is how it fits right beneath the bust. It folds up really weird and you can't fix it because it happens each time you move. The only way I got rid of it was when I stood straight as a stick and puffed my chest out, which isn't practical obviously. I tried the XS and it was very short. The S was the best I could do because I was traveling and didn't have time to get another dress. I wouldn't recommend this dress if you're worried about people looking at nonexistent rolls/pushes that this dress creates. The dress would look different under the bust each time I took a picture. Sometimes it'd only be one fold and others it'd be an asymmetrical single or double fold. It was super weird and unpleasant to know that the slip was doing its own thing with each move I made. Otherwise it was cute, but not worth the bad pictures! The lace was really thick, which didn't bother me too much, but it was a bit unexpected how thick it was compared to the thin slip under it.

Wore this dress to my bridal shower and I loved it! The liner is a little heavy so if you have an outside summer event it might be too hot of a dress. My shower was inside so it was perfect. Overall I loved this dress and it was really comfortable.

I wore this dress to a fashion show where attire is listed as Urban Chic, so really anything goes! It was flirty, fun and comfortable. My only complaint is that the interior dress, slip part, bunched up a little and it looked like rolls of fat. But I got over that and had a great time anyway. The bell sleeves are cool detail and since I recently got engaged, wearing white lace was extra fun. I got compliments all night long!

Love the lace and sleeves of this dress! I wore it for my bridal shower and it fit great while I was standing up, but was very short when I sat down - was a little uncomfortable while trying to sit and open gifts with everyone watching. The underlayer also tended to sneak up a bit. But, overall it was great for the shower and I felt lovely wearing it!

links_reviews_title: Pretty short, best for party you wont sit down!
links_reviews_text: Dress is well made, made me a bit box shaped and I am curvy. Very short, especially seated. I probably flashed everyone getting out of Uber.

links_reviews_title: This was a perfect cute, yet more modest dress for a Baptism.
links_reviews_text: Fit true to size. Just had a baby, so the shape of this dress was perfect for hiding a not to tight tummy.

Wore this for a graduation dinner and was perfect for this event. It is a simple but elegant dress that pops with a fun style. The sleeves are great as they are designed nicely and will not be near your plate - so feel free to eat dinner in this dress! Only issue is the lace can bunch up in upper mid-torso when seated and doesn't fully lay flat after. It is not a big deal but I did tug down on it a bit.

This dress is so beautiful and feels so expensive and high quality. It was super flattering, even with a large bust. I wore my typical size Medium, which was perfect, and I'd recommend ordering a size up for your backup just because it is more on the fitted side.
Cute, nice length. Runs slightly large. Fun cuffs!
It was great for my curves and long legs. I'm a 36 DD and have broad shoulders and it wasn't too tight. It also wasn't too short either! Best dress ever!

Wore this to a Kentucky derby party. I originally rented the medium, but it was tight in the bust (34DDD) the fabric kept bunching up (as you can also see here) so I sent the medium back for a large. Overall very cute, got tons of compliments.
Although the dress fit me a little loose I felt like very comfortable in it. Texture of the dress is really nice.

links_reviews_title: My husband loved this dress. He said it looked great on me and wants me to buy it.
links_reviews_text: I'm a Pastor's Wife so I wore it to church. I received a lot of compliments. My husband absolutely loved it.
Little shorter than I anticipated and definitely runs small. But loved the lace and sleeves!!! Tons of compliments.

Gorgeous Dress. Very delicate lace detailing but quality fabric. Perfect length. Wore to a Easter church service and brunch. I had to be careful with the sleeves while eating because they are big but it wasn't that big a deal. Felt very sexy and cute in this dress.

links_reviews_title: This dress was elegant and spot on for my nieces wedding. So many compliments...like no other.
links_reviews_text: This dress was true to size, although I personally need to come to terms that I need to change my primary size a size up. As some others mentioned the sleeves are snug, a bit restricting but didn’t keep me from dancing. The dress was snug for me around the hips which made it gather in the absolute worst place-my tummy!

links_reviews_title: A perfect choice for a black-tie optional gala event!
links_reviews_text: I received many compliments on this dress - even from perfect strangers. The blue color is much more vivid in person than in photos. It fit true to size and was comfortable to wear. I did wear a strapless black bra with the dress. Needed help with the zipper as it is a hidden type and difficult to zip with the lace fabric. I had planned to wear black heels but decided nude shoes looked better with this dress on me. It may be due to the longer length on me (I'm 5'6") but the black shoes seemed to draw the eye to my feet. Because the lace is so intricate, I decided it only needed earrings to complete the look. I was totally pleased with this dress and would rent it again!

links_reviews_title: I looked and felt AMAZING! So many complements !!!
links_reviews_text: True to size

This dress was perfect for a chilly evening wedding. The sleeves are pretty snug but I didn't have any issues. Lots and lots of compliments! Elegant and a bit conservative, but still sexy and fun. I felt like a million bucks, and it was super comfortable. If you've rented a Shoshanna dress before, this will not disappoint!!

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous color and extremely high quality material.
links_reviews_text: I wore this to a black tie optional wedding. Beautiful dress. I felt comfortable, yet flirty and fun. I was covered up, but the cut of the dress was flattering and a bit sexy. I ended up buying the dress because it was somthing that I could see myself wearing again, and the deal to buy the dress was only slightly more expensive than renting the dress. Received lots of compliments on the dress, too.

links_reviews_title: Sad to send this one back!
links_reviews_text: I loved wearing this dress. I am not a huge fan of my arms but it can be hard to find formal wear that isn't sleeveless. This dress fit well and was very comfortable, I had no issues with it during the night. Would rent again for a formal event!

links_reviews_title: The dress has its own personality, it speaks
links_reviews_text: The dress is a true fit but arm is huge so it was a little tight around the Arm, but it shows all my peace's in the right place. I'll suggest to have a good shape all around so it can look perfect.

I loved this dress - it was perfect for a chilly, fancy spring wedding. The cut was really flattering for my rear, and the length was modest, really pretty, and totally appropriate for black tie. Such a pretty color, and the fabric was comfy to dance in. Great dress!

links_reviews_title: Was ok. Runs a little small I sized down. Length was ok for my height
links_reviews_text: Comfortable dress. Work appropriate

I rented this dress for a work party, I received a lot of compliments on this dress. The arms are a little tight but it works out because it stretches after you wear it. I really like the way it hugs the curves of your body. Love it
This was the Perfect dress to wear to a "semi-formal-to-formal" wedding! It fit true to size, was comfortable to sit in, and rocked the dance floor! Rent it!

I rented this for a charity event where I am on the younger side in my late 30s. I thing it strikes a nice balance of business and fun. It was in great shape, and at the discount offered I strongly considered purchasing.

I'm usually not a fan of three-quarter length sleeves or a trumpet skirt, but when I tell you this dress is so very very pretty on -you can't even imagine. The photograph doesn't do it justice. It's comfortable as well. It's more blue than navy and the trim on the embroidery is black so you can wear black shoes

This dress was okay. It was a bit too mature for me, but I wore it to dinner at a country club nonetheless. It was an older crowd. The zipper was difficult to manage around the lace, so I don't recommend renting this if you don't have someone to help you with that. Its long, and would be better on a girl a few inches taller than me. Lastly, I found the hips too high on the dress - but I have a long torso so that might not be an issue for others.

links_reviews_title: Love this! Went back and bought it.
links_reviews_text: Love this dress, nice and form fitting but not constructive. The blue is so pretty in person. Rented this during my post baby period and loved it so much I re rented it for another wedding in a smaller size and bought.

links_reviews_title: I felt comfortable and beautiful in this dress at my husband's company holiday party.
links_reviews_text: The fit will hug, but with some proper undergarments, I thought it fit well. It was impossible to zip up the dress without help because it wanted to catch on the lace. Arms might've been a wee bit tight, but it wasn't a big deal. All in all this was a great choice for for a company holiday party, and I received a ton of compliments on the dress.

links_reviews_title: The compliments received on the color of the dress solidified my RTR experience!!!
links_reviews_text: The dress fit true to size. It was fitted in all the right places and still gave me the right amount of room the the waist, which made the dress comfortable. The arms were a tad snug but not uncomfortable. The color and material of this dress is absolutely beautiful in person. I actually rented a different dress, similar style however a stylist emailed me stating one of the 2 sizes was not up to their specs to rent it out. They chose another dress for no additional cost. I received 2 dresses and ended up wearing the stylist choice! This was my first RTR experience and I will be back!
I wore this to church for New Years and it was a great alternative to a glittery dress or outfit! Fit was nice but with the design of the fabric there was not much give. I would wear this again.

links_reviews_title: Unique dress for cool weather wedding
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress to a Wedding in LA in February. The contrasting lace colors looked beautiful! The lace was thick enough to provide some warmth along w the sleeves in the cooler weather. I was worried about the fit of the skirt on dress on a pear shape but it was not clingy at all.
Beautiful dress. Some coverage - I liked it for a holiday work gala in a usually cold venue.

Wanted something sexy but understated for a family wedding and this dress was perfect. I usually wear a 4, but this dress in 4 restricted the movement of my arms/shoulders.i have broad shoulders. There is no stretch in the lace. So I wore the 6 and it was formfitting enough. It didn't seem too large.

links_reviews_title: So many compliments on this dress!
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress to a conservative religious wedding where you are expected to cover knees, elbows and collar bones. I was getting compliments ALL night! This dress has an absolutely beautiful structure and weight to it with intricate lace detail. I ordered a 0 and 2. Both fit but the 0 was a little too hiphugging for a conservative event (guys - my booty POPPED). I ended up wearing the 2 which was still very flattering and elegant. Would rent this again!

links_reviews_title: Loved the dress! Perfect amount of style without being over the top.
links_reviews_text: Fit true to size

links_reviews_title: Great for different types of events
links_reviews_text: I wore this to a daytime event, and though sheer on top, i felt comfortable for the conservative event i was attending, my son's cotillion parent dance. It was form fitting yet very comfortable, a little give in the mid section, but not much. I was able to wear a normal strapless bra for support. I almost wore a black tank under as well for more modesty, but didnt think I needed it at the last minute. The top was sheer, but the flower lace pattern was heavy and I felt covered up.
Got this via update and had to return for a smaller size. 4 was perfect- hugged in all the right places without feeling restrictive. Gorgeous dress for a wedding!

links_reviews_title: gorgeous fabric but poor fit for petite girls
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress for Christmas and got tons of compliments. but the sleeves and dress length were too long for a petite build. The waist section right beneath the bust was also awkwardly large and saggy but it wasnt that noticeable.

links_reviews_title: Since I loved this dress the first time, why not wear it for my 40th birthday?
links_reviews_text: This dress is a nice heavy dress which is good for colder temperatures. It fit me perfectly so I didn't need my backup size. I had already rented it for a holiday party back in December and was complimented a lot on it. The only issue is that the zipper is sticky, I needed help getting it up and down once the dress was on. Otherwise, the color is beautiful and the floral detail in the lacing really made the dress. Perfect pairing with a simple pair of black heels and clutch. You can even get away with wearing a bra w/ straps as long as it's a nude color that blends with your skin tone. (I try everything I can to avoid strapless)

links_reviews_title: So many compliments on this dress!
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress for an evening work event held at a museum downtown and received so many compliments on it all night long, not only from those attending the event, but also employees of the museum too! The dress fit perfectly and was comfortable enough to move around all evening. There is not a lot of stretch or room in the sleeves / shoulders because of the lace material, but this wasn't an issue for me at all. The zipper does stick a bit when unzipping. I would definitely rent this dress again, and wish it was in my closet full time!! If you're debating about whether to rent this dress or not, you should definitely rent it!!

links_reviews_title: I wore this to a gala for my job and it fit beautifully, and I felt amazing in it, would recommend!!
links_reviews_text: I found it to be a tad too big, but I tend to me a very small person...

This dress is absolutely fabulous. I've never received so many compliments on a dress in one night! It's classy, elegant, and a total show-stopper. Can't rave about it enough. It fits true to size as well.

links_reviews_title: This was one of my back-up dresses and I ended up loving it! Tons of compliments!
links_reviews_text: This fits true to size and has a flattering fit. I'm 4 months post-baby and still have some baby weight in my mid-section. It was a little noticeable since this dress is a bit tight fitting around the waist. With the detailed flare at the bottom and sheer lace on top, there was plenty of detail to distract. The color is beautiful!
Runs true to size. Can't raise your arms much, so it's out for a dancing event. Otherwise a great dress.

links_reviews_title: Elegant with a hint of edginess
links_reviews_text: I'm short. Like real short. I was nervous that this would look goofy on me since all of the other reviewers were at least 6" taller than me. It ended up being perfect and fun. I wore this to 2 galas over the weekend where I was the auctioneer. I got compliments up the wazoo. It was conservative but the cut made it feel sexy. I will rent this again. Perfect floral for a fall gala!
Such a great dress, comfort with a whole lot of style. Defiantly a crowd stand out!
Wore this for Cinco De Mayo with coworkers. Wanted a fun colorful Dress. Got so many compliments. Didn't need much accessories since the dress has so much going on. Beautiful color and embroidery.
The dress is comfortable and perfect for a dressy affair. The zipper sticks a little.

links_reviews_title: Perfect combination of figure flattering, modest, and sexy
links_reviews_text: Looked great, was genuinely comfortable, and hid some things while making me look amazing.

links_reviews_title: Great dress for a conservative wedding
links_reviews_text: Great dress for a lot of compliments! Although the collar did choke me while sitting and the lace got caught on other women's jewelry. I loved this dress for a conservative event like a wedding for orthodox Jewish folk!

links_reviews_title: Wore for a performance - good fit, feminine, conservative.
links_reviews_text: Fit well, a little limitation in movement of arms.
I received lots of compliments on this beautiful dress. The combination of rich color and the unique lace print made this dress stand out. It was also very comfortable.
This is so well made and the fabric and pattern are exquisite. It's definitely more sparkly than the picture shows, in a good way! Loved this!

links_reviews_title: One of my favorite dresses so far!
links_reviews_text: Got a bunch of compliments on it.

I wore this dress to a chamber of commerce meeting, and looked amazing. The dress is well made and comfortable. I have a large chest that was a little snug at first but felt perfect after wearing it little while
I wore the dress to a formal party on a cruise. Pictures don't do justice to this dress. It exudes quality, luxury, and class. Highly recommend.

The dress was tailored to perfection. It molds lightly to your body (in a good way). This is an expensive dress and it shows. Plan on receiving a lot of compliments when you wear it. I would recommend this dress for woman 50+.

links_reviews_title: Thick material. Large in the hips
links_reviews_text: This is a beautiful dress. Runs large, especially in the hips.

links_reviews_title: Nice dress - good for work or party
links_reviews_text: Nice pattern and cut- very flattering waistline. Comfortable to wear. Thicker fabric than expected. Also thought the dress was black based on pics but it's dark navy. Rented a 2R and probably should have gone for petite or sizes down - but still looked good.
Very comfortable and great fabric. The cut at the hip is a little strange, but overall a great dress.
It is a tight fit but the dress is luxurious. Very thick material and gorgeous cut. Would rent again!

links_reviews_title: Great Fabric, Not Great for Hips
links_reviews_text: The dress was made of very nice quality fabric and I was sad I couldn't wear it. It was loose up top and very tight around the hips. I would size up if you have hips.

This dress is gorgeous. I rented for back up for a party thinking I'd wear to work if not. Could not do that because the silver flowers sparkle so nsfw. But amazing-- looks expensive, fit and fabric are fabulous. I look forward to having a chance to wear sometime.
Below the knee, heavy, expensive-feeling fabric, sleek and absolutely gorgeous.
Unfortunately couldn't wear it since it was too snug on the hips.
Fits very well. The material is thick, but that means it hangs very well. I wouldn't have wanted to wear it if I was any shorter than 5'5" given the length.

links_reviews_title: I ultimately didn't end up wearing this dress because it was too tight around the hips.
links_reviews_text: I loved the pattern, but found that it was too tight around the hips.
I ordered this on a whim and regret it! I didn't read the description, but the material is scuba and the seams are THICK in the hip area, so I looked WIDE. The bust was weirdly small. Didn't wear.
If you're over a D cup, this is going to be tight in the top. The material is interesting - almost like a very thin comforter. I didn't expert the gray to be shiny silver.
Looked nice.

links_reviews_title: Tough fit made this dress impossible to wear
links_reviews_text: I wanted this dress to work so badly because the fabric is BEAUTIFUL. I read reviews and ultimately decided to go with size 4. I range from sizes 2-6, because I have larger breasts for my frame. I knew it might be a little tight in my bust, but planned to not wear a bra if needed. Neither "runs small" or "runs large" are accurate...it was tight at my bust and underbust, fit in the waist and was HUGE in the hips. The fabric is stiff, so the hips stuck out and made me look bigger than I am. This will only work if you have small breasts and are hippy. If I was buying it, I would need to buy a size 6 and take in the waist to a 4 and hips to a 2. Really disappointed because it's a great dress!

links_reviews_title: Small across the back and shoulders
links_reviews_text: Absolutely gorgeous fabric. Runs small across back and shoulders. Too tight to wear.

I wish this had worked because the fabric was really thick, lustrous and classy, but the cut was just all wrong for me. I tried a size 0 (I'm 5'4.5" and around 113 pounds, 34c, and usually wear a 0 or 2), and it was too tight in the bust to zip. The hips fit, but the side seams did not lie flat, visually adding width where I want it the least.
loved the dress, but didn't end up wearing it because I preferred the other item I rented. The dress fit well around the breast (I'm 36C) but was a little big around the hips.

Fabric is so thick like quilted. Once you get past the thickness it's beautiful. I got a few compliments. The waist is flattering but I felt that I could have sized down. It was bulky like too structured. I just didn't felt like my best.
Couldn't get near it to be able to wear!

I wore this dress with a shawl in lower temps and was comfortable. The material is a bit thicker which I find more forgiving of an imperfect body. It didn't make me look heavy though and I got lots of compliments, especially of a photo of myself in the dress.
This dress is beautiful and so comfortable to wear. Really luxurious.

links_reviews_title: The dress is beautiful but a little big. I didn't end up wearing it.
links_reviews_text: material and pattern is beautiful.

links_reviews_title: Great customer service, don't hesitate to call.
links_reviews_text: Beautifully made dress. Fabric is thick and perfect for Fall and Winter events. I returned because it was too small. It was not available in the next size up.
Didn't wear way to big. Rich looking dress.

links_reviews_title: Wore this for a keynote speech--beautiful but wrinkles easily and too long for short women!
links_reviews_text: The fabric is amazing and it looks very expensive--but it wrinkled quickly and wasn't very flattering for some petite like me (5'3")

This dress is amazing! The metallic details are stunning. It looks (and is) like a very expensive dress. Wore the 4 because the 2 was unavailable, so it was a bit big, but because of the cut of the dress I could carry it off. Would love to rent again.

links_reviews_title: This dress is extremely unique with undeniable craftsmanship.
links_reviews_text: There is no stretch to the dress. It fit like glove and definitely kept my posture in check even after dinner. This works for a professional event--just use your dinner napkin strategically when seated.
Beautiful, well made dress. However, I didn't end up wearing it because of how it fit in the chest (very tight, but fit everywhere else), and how stiff/not flow-y it was. Came new with tags.
I liked this dress in theory. The material is a little crinkly, but overall it was really comfortable to wear to a 12 course dinner. The fit isn't perfect, but it is forgiving.

You can wear this dress almost anywhere for any occasion. I loved it but the material felt like a tarp. It was very comfortable and didn't look cheap but I'm not how it is sold as a 1700 dress. Really my only complaint was that I would have loved to keep it.

After a few magnificent rented items which I just HAD to buy, finally, here's a quintessential "rent don't buy" case study. It's cute enough - and the fabric is addictive enough - to wear once or twice; but for my 5"2 frame it's just too long (I'm referring to the "mini skirt" part of the dress) and the pattern is a bit dated, albeit special; not to mention - it's a very expensive piece of fashion art ;). So yes; I have indeed enjoyed wearing it but at the same time, will not shed a tear when we part ways.

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous and weird all at the same time...
links_reviews_text: I really loved this dress, despite how large is was on me and the weird fabric. I felt like one of my grandmother's table cloths, but I loved the colors, the shape and how unique it is. I will definitely rent again, but size down at least one, maybe two sizes.
Material is a little "Kringly". I thought it looked better with the sweater over- the hemline is a little crazy
IMO it needed a belt. Loved the print.

I loved this dress! Great detail, gorgeous pattern. Colors were not what I thought, but really great--wine, olive, brown on a grey background. I thought it was red and pink and black from the photo! It was a cold day so I wore it with a wine cropped cardigan. Easy to layer for winter, would be a perfect late summer dress.

i loved wearing this dress! the cut of the hem makes it really special (short in the front, long on the sides and back) and there's lots of swoosh with the extra material for some "wow," and the fabric is treated with something that makes it feel almost shellacked; really cool. the arm holes are maybe a bit high, but not uncomfortable, and there's no peekaboo with the bra straps (always a plus). i note that RTR should take a look at the zipper: it is a bit stiff, and there is a slight rip in the fabric at the base by the zipper on the dress i got, likely because of the stiffness. otherwise, total winner!
This dress runs really big. Had to belt it. Material is a little strange

The fabric IS a bit stiff and noisy as others are describing, but I didn't find it uncomfortable and it didn't bother me. It runs large - I got two sizes down from my usual and it fit perfectly, but it has no give so maybe try a couple sizes. Loved the asymmetrical cut.
This dress wasn't what I expected. The fabric is very crisp, thin and crunchy. I thought it would drape over the body, but I needed to belt it. The print and colors are great.

links_reviews_title: Fabulous dress! Super comfortable and flattering and very different and cute.
links_reviews_text: Oh how I love this dress!! I wore it for a brunch after a wedding. It was a casual brunch so dressed it down with short boots and a denim jacket. I'm going to wear it next week with gold jewelry and a cashmere shrug for an evening party. This dress is super-fun. Everyone gave me compliments and I felt so great. It's perfect for my pear shaped body because its very tailored up top but then gets bigger below and doesn't cling. The fabric is very lightweight and almost papery... it's strange but great! And very flattering.

I freaking love this dress. I would buy it if I could afford it but it is quite expensive. I've worn it twice since having it and plan to wear it a few more before sending it back. The fit is perfect. The length is really fun. It matches with a ton of different things so you can easily dress it up or dress it down depending on your event. I do think it runs large. I typically wear a 12, sometimes even a 14 in designer brands. I easily fit into the 10 in this and it wasn't tight at all. It does have a slightly odd material but I think it looks great.

This dress is cute but is runs big so I belted it. I am usually a size 6 or 8 (leaning 8 due to my big bum) but this size 42 was a GOWN on me. Not to mention, the dress is definitely made from the same material of a painter's jumpsuit- it's a thick, paper-like material!

Wore this for a friend's baby shower-layered with a cashmere sweater. I am going to wear it again with nude heels for a cocktail party. Versatile and comfortable. Fabric is kinda weird-stiff, not stretchy... almost rain jacket like. I didn't bother me, and it didn't wrinkle which was really nice. I found it be a touch roomy, but overall I rate it true to size. The length is very flattering.

This dress is absolutely gorgeous. The material does not wrinkle and the colors invoke Fall. That being said, it's true to size with the exception of the breast area. There's really not much room in there if you have a large bust. If you like your clothing tight then go a size down (that is, if you have small to medium breasts). Otherwise, stick with your size or go a size up if you have PLENTY of boobies. I styled it with an ornate, multicolor necklace and a dainty ear cuff (my own).

links_reviews_title: Beautiful dress for event or anytime
links_reviews_text: I wore this to work and also to a concert at a gallery - very easy to dress up or down. I'm not usually a fan of a handkerchief hemline but this dress was a stunner. Fit: true to size, not super fitted but body-hugging in a relaxed way as the fabric does not have stretch. Great for work and more conservative functions as it is flattering in the bust but offers fills coverage (at the arm holes included) and it is really quite short in the front (I liked how it showed off my legs) but because of the drape of the skirt in the sides/back and overall volume it doesn't feel skimpy. Fabric is very light and smooth, almost crinkly but it doesn't wrinkle, very comfortable and good for warm weather. Could be worn with tights to downplay the shorter length in the front or to transition seasons.

I loved this dress. It was unique, comfortable, and super flattering. It ran about half a size large so size down if you are between sizes. It is supposed to be fitted across the chest and loose in the body, and that is exactly how it fit me. The dress is a bit on the short side, so I would say that if you are taller than 5'5" it is probably not going to be office appropriate. I wore this to work all day and to a cocktail party at the end of the day. Love. Love. Love.

Rented this for a dinner with other work couples. As the other reviews state, it's definitely a weird fabric. I was able to steam out the wrinkles and held up really nice. It runs big, as with all Marnie items, but still loved it. Fabric is not too loud, but just enough to stand out

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous fit and fabric, comfy as pajamas, nonstop compliments!
links_reviews_text: I wore this dress twice--once to a birthday party and once onstage for my band's gig. Both times it was a head turner, and extremely comfortable as well. I really don't want to return it! :)

The fabric on this dress almost feels like paper. It's pretty crunchy but doesn't wrinkle at all! It definitely runs large so size down. I probably even could've worn a 4. It was loose in the waist and had room in the bust. Perfect dress for work or even a classy date night! Loved the dress!

I think I could have gone down a size in this dress but I didn't mind the looser fit. The smaller size might have been too tight in the bust. The fabric is interesting, a type of chintz I think. Noisy at times but nothing too bad for me! I loved the asymmetrical hemline that was accentuated with the more stiff fabric. Really well made, fun dress to wear!

This dress has a very pretty print and nice colors that allow you to have fun when accessorizing. It ran a bit large on me, but looks nice with the room it gave me. Very comfortable and loose fitting. I recommend going down a size for back up. Any standard undergarments and bra are fine. The fabric has no stretch and makes a swooshy sound. Has a nice professional and fashionable look to it.

This is another Marni I really like! It is cut a bit tight across the chest so no need for any padded bra. The asymmetrical bottom is so interesting. The fabric was a surprise because I expected silk or something softer but it's a poplin so its rather swooshy when you walk but good for summer.

This dress did not work in any possible way for work. The hem looked downright weird, and the cut is not flattering for a petite person at all. I put it on and knew I'd never be able to wear it anywhere. Maybe try it for a summer cocktail party or something. If you are someone tall.

This dress is an interesting style that worked well with tall brown boots and a short jacket BUT it stretched weird across my chest... the rest fit nicely so a bigger size may have looked weird elsewhere

As other reviewers mentioned, the material is thin and paper-like so was great to pack for a a weekend away as it was light and didn't wrinkle. Was super comfortable but not the most flattering. I think it would have been better in a smaller size.

This was such an unusual and fun to wear dress. The poplin fabric does feel slightly papery. Modern, very flattering print. As with all Marni, this runs slightly big, but it wasn't the tent on me that most Marni dresses are. I did belt the waist, although it looked fine unbelted as well. This got me tons of compliments at work and at an art gallery event. Do beware that the material is pretty thin and summery - this is not a winter dress! Will definitely rent again.

links_reviews_title: Overall cut was so bizarre and my breasts were openly exposed
links_reviews_text: Very bizzarre. Wanted to love since fabric was lovely but it was cut so odd my breasts kept falling out and the waist was also weird and lumpy.

I work in a creative field and chose this for a work event. The material is unusual, thin but a little stiff, which works for this dress. It holds pleasing shapes that look different from different angles and that makes it an engaging piece. It's also very relaxed and comfortable. The colors on the print shoe up more in person and are really lovely too.

This dress is amazing, the material is quite unique, only one slight problem was the shoulders were definitley made for someone with a slightly longer torso. But it was still great! loved it and wore it with a belt as recommended by others.
Can't really say anything that hasn't already been said. Amazing dress and I felt like a million bucks in it.
Fit nicely, but felt very covered up. The material is exactly like that of a tent fly, but it surprisingly works well for this dress cut.

links_reviews_title: Cool print, unexpected fabric, strange fit
links_reviews_text: I'm normally up for oddly fitting dresses in unusual fabrics (especially by Marni) but this one didn't work for me. The center-front of the skirt was really straight and hit at an unflattering place on my leg. All the folds were off to the side. There were curves in the body of the dress that seemed to bow out in odd places. Maybe a smaller size would have been better but it also seemed like the zipper would not be low enough to pull on if you went smaller.

I absolutely hated this dress. The fabric feels like a thin shower curtain. I kept referring it to the garbage dress because it felt like a garbage bag. The fabric made a lot of noise every time I moved even slightly. I bought this for brunch after a friend's wedding, but returned it in hopes of getting something new in time. On top of the weird fabric, it was pretty big. The cut of the hem of the skirt is very weird. No elegant draping, but I guess it would have to be that way considering the fabric.

links_reviews_title: Didn't love it, didn't wear it.
links_reviews_text: Rented this for a work event but I didn't love the fit. The dress seemed too wide at the waist and was probably just a bad pick for my height. I did like the short back/longer sides but I didn't love the the front seam where the two lengths met. The fabric felt like a rain jacket. Ended up returning it without wearing it.

Others have commented on the material of this dress. I thought it would be edgy, it just felt and looked like a tarp. My teenager said "It looks like what rich people wear when they want to look poor." It was unflattering and the material design was also ugly. I did not like.
To me, this dress hung like an unflattering tarp. It may scream high fashion on someone that can wear it well, but it was wasted on my short curvy body.
Too big - take a size smaller
